head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: School Study To Include Meetings With Parents

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: School Study To Include Meetings With Parents

body.head.byline: By Jennifer Medina (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: metro briefing**City Education Dept will hold more than 70 meetings with parents in next three months as part of $4 million study of New York school system (S)

block.p: The city's Department of Education will hold more than 70 meetings with parents in the next three months as part of a $4 million study of the New York City school system. At the second meeting of the Panel for Educational Policy, the former Board of Education, Chancellor Joel I. Klein last night announced plans to collect information from parents, students and community groups. Earlier this month, Mr. Klein announced plans to use private donations for a study of the school system. Department officials will also use youth organizations to set up meetings with students.

The city's Department of Education will hold more than 70 meetings with parents in the next three months as part of a $4 million study of the New York City school system. At the second meeting of the Panel for Educational Policy, the former Board of Education, Chancellor Joel I. Klein last night announced plans to collect information from parents, students and community groups. Earlier this month, Mr. Klein announced plans to use private donations for a study of the school system. Department officials will also use youth organizations to set up meetings with students.
